snippet: The companies making the narcotic painkillers OxyContin and Opana have introduced tamper-resistant pills, hoping to slow adoption of the drugs’ generic versions.
abstract: Purdue Pharma and Endo Pharmaceuticals, makers of brand name pain-relief drugs OxyContin and Opana, introduce versions that are more resistant to tampering techniques abusers use to release the pills' narcotics; companies hope that move will convince regulators to delay generic versions of the drugs that are not tamper-resistant, arguing that older designs will feed street demand for strong painkillers.

byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and BARRY MEIER

lead_paragraph: The companies making the narcotic painkillers OxyContin and Opana have introduced tamper-resistant pills, hoping to slow adoption of the drugs’ generic versions.

headline.main: Drug Makers Losing a Bid to Foil Generic Painkillers
headline.print_headline: Drug Makers Losing a Bid To Foil Generic Painkillers
